name: selective coating, stainless steel sheet, black chrome | selective coat, stainless steel sheet, black chrome | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6456/documentation

Inventory for selective coatings of solar absorbers. For black chrome and black nickel the solar absorbance is a=0.91~0.98 and thermal emittance is e=0.06~0.14.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

The activity starts with the sheet entering the process. The material on which this activity is applied it is not included as input.

Gate to gate inventory for the process including infrastructure. No information for waste and packages.
category: C:Manufacturing/25:Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment/259:Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activit/2592:Treatment and coating of metals; machining

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Black chrome coating. The main process stages used for the process are: Cleaning with electrolytic wash bath at ambient temperature (20°C), Activation, Black coating at ambient temperature (20°C), Recuperation baths, Reduction bath

exchanges.description:
Questionnaire, water is evaporated.
Calculated based on literature, (Vionnet, S., Quantis Water Database - Technical Report, 2012). Thickness of the coating layer is 2microm. The process starts when untreated surface enters the coating plant. It includes the processes: pre-treatment (cleaning) and coating itself.
